The growth plate in my right elbow was almost broken off when I broke my arm about 9 years ago
Could the doctors not set up back correctly?
It didn‚Äôt break completely - it just cracked down the middle, almost all the way through, but not quite
I just googled it and...you are in a lot of pain when you don't use your arm a certain way right?
It healed completely but I can‚Äôt bend my arm all the way up like I can my left and it‚Äôs weaker
But it‚Äôs not anything obvious

I had hurt my wrist really bad about five years ago. My family and I were moving and I tripped and landed completely on my left wrist. Ever now and then it hurts, but if I life something really heavy I injure it really easy and cannot lift anything.
I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs that bad, but I try to leave the heavier stuff to my left arm and hold most of the weight of anything I carry on that side too
Weight lifting may be a good idea to regain some of the strength I lost
Now that I think about it, my wrist has not acted up lately so hopeful just a few more years and it will be like it never happened. Has your fracture never healed?
weight lifting is fun.
It‚Äôs shown to be healed, but I also don‚Äôt know if that elbow has a new stress limit
It has a bit of a mobility restriction now and strength decrease, so what if I end up rebreaking it

Well, it will be healed but it is weaker then before the injury. I am not sure about bone though I would assume it is similar. If you injure a muscle, not like lifting but like tearing, it takes years before it is fully healed.

I tore the left side of my lower back working at UPS and like my wrist it is easily re-injured. It just takes time I think. I would assume in from your case the bone either takes significantly longer or if you break it it will forever be weaker there.
I also chipped a bone in my right ankle. The doctors said the chip was fusing to the back of my foot bone
I think all I could do is try to regain the muscle strength I lost while the arm was healing
Boy...you really injure yourself. Did you do a lot of risky things or is it just a lot of bad luck?
My ankles are double jointed
Ohh yeah, physical therapy is very important after an injury.
